body: $PQEFF so many will say its a stretch but I find it considerably coincidental. The term "Viston" seems generic enough
created_at: almost to the point I thought I've once even heard the term before. However
column3: after completing a significant term search in TESS and translations across German
column6: the word is actually not common at all. I believe some believe Viston is acting on behalf of a major oil player
column7: a theory I tend to believe.

body: The closest term I found to Viston was "Vistone"
created_at: which is registered by ExxonMobil and used by them for the past 25 years as a tradename in the USPTO TESS database category of "..chemical additives
column3: namely synthetic fluids used to improve the quality of oil". The term was also registered in Brussels through the EUIPO (European Union Intellectual Property Office) .

Obviously wasn't expecting much information

body: $PQEFF My German broker (Flatex) told me just now

body: Here is the full response (translated from
German to English via Google)
The offer that was placed in your document archive on November 23
created_at: 2021 can currently only be accepted for securities that were already in your securities account at the time. The cash compensation offer will not be taken into account for items that you bought at a later date.

body: Mr. Xxxxx
